description: a(n) = n! * number of partitions of n.
comments: Commuting permutations: number of ordered pairs g, h in Sym(n) such that gh = hg.Equivalently sum of the order of all normalizers of all cyclic subgroups of Sym(n). [_Olivier GÃ©rard_, Apr 04 2012]
references: R. P. Stanley, Enumerative Combinatorics, Cambridge, Vol. 2, 1999; see Problem 5.12, solution.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
M. Holloway, M. Shattuck, Commuting pairs of functions on a finite set, PU.M.A, Volume 24 (2013), Issue No. 1.
M. Holloway, M. Shattuck, Commuting pairs of functions on a finite set, Research Gate, 2015.
R. P. Stanley, Pairs with equal squares, Problem 10654, Amer. Math. Monthly, 107 (April 2000), solution p. 368.
formula: E.g.f: sum(n>=0, x^n/prod(k=1,n,1-x^k)) = exp(sum(n>=1, 1/n*x^n/(1-x^n))). - _Joerg Arndt_, Jan 29 2011
prog: (PARI) N=66; x='x+O('x^N); Vec(serlaplace(exp(sum(k=1, N, x^k/(1-x^k)/k)))) \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 16 2010(PARI) N=66; x='x+O('x^N); Vec(serlaplace(sum(n=0, N, x^n/prod(k=1,n,1-x^k)))) \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Jan 29 2011
crossrefs: Sequences counting pairs of functions from an n-set to itself: A053529, A181162, A239749-A239785, A239836-A239841.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 16 2000
